caption.p: Lipid droplets and the mRNA expression levels of the fibrotic marker α-SMA in LX-2 cells. ( A) Lipid droplets in LX-2 cells were stained by Oil Red O and quantitatively detected. Oil red O staining in activated LX-2 cells significantly decreased, while staining markedly increased after the addition of 20 µM of the PPARγ agonist rosiglitazone ( n = 3). Arrows refer to the stained lipid droplets. ( B) Compared with quiesced cells, the mRNA level of α-SMA in activated LX-2 cells increased, while the α-Sma gene was conspicuously suppressed by 24 h of treatment with 20 µM rosiglitazone ( n = 3). Mean values ± SD are presented. ## P < 0.01 vs. the activated LX-2 group, # P < 0.05 vs. the activated LX-2 group.
